metadata.title: CVE-2020-14351 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in the Linux kernel. A use-after-free memory flaw wasfound in the perf subsystem allowing a local attacker with permission tomonitor perf events to corrupt memory and possibly escalate privileges. Thehighest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality andintegrity as well as system availability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-14351` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-197-generic - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-lowlatency - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-4.4.0-197-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-197-generic - 4.4.0-197.229
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-197-lowlatency - 4.4.0-197.229
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-126-generic - 4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-126-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-126-lowlatency - 4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-126-generic - 4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-126-lowlatency - 4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1084-kvm - 4.4.0-1084.93
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1118-aws - 4.4.0-1118.132
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1088-aws - 4.15.0-1088.93~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1100-azure - 4.15.0-1100.111~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1088-gcp - 4.15.0-1088.101~16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-197.229').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-126.129~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1084.93').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1118.132').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1088.93~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1100.111~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1088.101~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.65~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1142.152').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1146.156').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
